summary: This is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing travel logistics and approvals for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The primary focus is on planning a trip to Stockholm, Sweden for an interview, including hotel and flight bookings, per diem issues, and bureaucratic frustrations. The chain references multiple prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Maureen Comey
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial travel approval request for the Epstein investigation, requesting permission for travel to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale in March 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The prosecution team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in Florida
events.description: Initial travel request for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a series of email exchanges from January 2020 among SDNY staff coordinating travel for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618).
The primary purpose of the discussed trip is to conduct an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, indicating the international scope of the investigation.
The emails reference multiple prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach throughout 2019, showing ongoing investigative activity.
Staff express frustration with bureaucratic travel systems (E2), noting incorrect hotel locations and inflated prices compared to public booking sites.
The FBI's Legal Attach√© (Legat) may assist with hotel bookings through the U.S. Embassy in Stockholm, indicating inter-agency cooperation.
